SENT.plain: Six patients who developed phlegmasia cerulea dolens are described
All patients had associated hypercoagulable states: heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (2 patients), congenital deficiency of protein C (1 patient), and antithrombin III deficiency (3 patients)
Their clinical course and management are discussed
Previous reports have failed to show a definite correlation between phlegmasia cerulea dolens and hypercoagulable states because of an unavailability of appropriate diagnostic techniques
Phlegmasia cerulea dolens is a life- and limb-threatening complication
An appreciation of underlying hypercoagulable states is essential to proper management, prophylaxis, and treatment of this disorder
